gurmukhi: ੴ> ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਪ੍ਰਸਾਦਿ ||
transliteration: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?
translation: One Oankaar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

gurmukhi: ੧ ਲੇਲਾ ਮਜਨੂੰ ਅਾਦ ਪ੍ਰੇਮੀ
transliteration: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?
translation: One Oankaar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

gurmukhi: ਲੇਲੈ ਮਜਨੂੰ ਅਾਸਕੀ ਚਹੁ ਚਕੀ ਜਾਤੀ
transliteration: Lailay Majanoon Aasakee Chahu Chakee Jaatee.
translation: The lovers Lana and Majanu are well known in all the quarters of the world.

gurmukhi: ਸੋਰਠਿ ਬੀਜਾ ਗਾਵੀਅੈ ਜਸੁ ਸੁਘੜਾ ਵਾਤੀ
transliteration: Soratdi Beejaa Gaaveeai Jasu Sougharhaa Vaatee.
translation: The excellent song of Sorath and Bija is sung in every direction.

gurmukhi: ਸਸੀ ਪੁੰਨੂੰ ਦੋਸਤੀ ਹੁੲਿ ਜਾਤਿ ਅਜਾਤੀ
transliteration: Sasee Pounnoon Dosatee Hui Jaati Ajaatee.
translation: The love of Sassi and Punnü, though of different castes, is everywhere spoken of.

gurmukhi: ਮੇਹੀਵਾਲ ਨੋ ਸੋਹਣੀ ਨੈ ਤਰਦੀ ਰਾਤੀ
transliteration: Mayheevaal No Sohanee Nai Taradee Raatee.
translation: The fame of Sohni who used to swim the Chenab river in the ht to meet Mahival is well known.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਂਝਾ ਹੀਰ ਵਖਾਣੀਅੈ ਓਹੁ ਪਿਰਮ ਪਰਾਤੀ
transliteration: Raanjhaa Heer Vakhaaneeai Aohu Piram Paraatee.
translation: Ranjha and Hir are renowned for the love they bore each other.

gurmukhi: ਪੀਰ ਮੁਰੀਦਾ ਪਿਰਹੜੀ ਗਾਵਨਿ ਪਰਭਾਤੀ ||੧||
transliteration: Peer Mureedaa Piraharhee Gaavani Parabhaatee ?1?
translation: But superior to all is the love the disciples bear their Guru.They sing it at the ambrosial hour of morning.

gurmukhi: ੨ ਮੁਰੀਦਾਂ ਦੀ ਪ੍ਰੀਤਿ
translation: Love of the disciples

gurmukhi: ਅਮਲੀ ਅਮਲੁ ਨ ਛਡਨੀ ਹੁੲਿ ਬਹਨਿ ੲਿਕਠੇ
transliteration: Amalee Amalu N Chhadanee Hui Bahani Ikatday.
translation: Opium-eaters eschew not opium and sit down together to eat it.

gurmukhi: ਜਿੳੁ ਜੂੲੇ ਜੂਅਾਰੀਅਾ ਲਗਿ ਦਾਵ ੳੁਪਠੇ
transliteration: Jiu Jooay Jooaareeaa Lagi Daav Oupatday.
translation: Gamblers indulge in play and lose their stakes.

gurmukhi: ਚੋਰੀ ਚੋਰ ਨ ਪਲਰਹਿ ਦੁਖ ਸਹਨਿ ਗਰਠੇ
transliteration: Choree Chor N Palarahi Doukh Sahani Garatday.
translation: Thieves do not abandon thieving and suffer punishment when caught.

gurmukhi: ਰਹਨਿ ਨ ਗਣਿਕਾ ਵਾੜਿਅਹੁ ਵੇਕਰਮੀ ਲਠੇ
transliteration: Rahani N Ganikaa Vaarhiahu Vaykaramee Latday.
translation: The evil-doers do not remain away from the house of the ill-repute women though they sell off even their clothes to provide for them.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਪੀ ਪਾਪੁ ਕਮਾਵਦੇ ਹੋੲਿ ਫਿਰਦੇ ਨਠੇ
transliteration: Paapee Paapu Kamaavaday Hoi Dhiraday Natday.
translation: Sinners commit sin anu abscond to avoid punishment.

gurmukhi: ਪੀਰ ਮੁਰੀਦਾ ਪਿਰਹੜੀ ਸਭ ਪਾਪ ਪਣਠੇ ||੨||
transliteration: Peer Mureedaa Piraharhee Sabh Paap Panatday ?2?
translation: But, contrary to all these, the Sikhs of the Guru, (whose companionship is far from being injurious) love their Guru, and he absolves them of all their sins.

gurmukhi: ੩ ਮੁਰੀਦਾਂ ਦੀ ਪ੍ਰੀਤਿ
translation: Love of the disciples

gurmukhi: ਭਵਰੈ ਵਾਸੁ ਵਿਣਾਸੁ ਹੈ ਫਿਰਦਾ ਫੁਲਵਾੜੀ
transliteration: Bhavarai Vaasu Vinaasu Hai Dhiradaa Phulavaarhee.
translation: The black bee gets perished while enjoying the fragrance in the garden.

gurmukhi: ਜਲੈ ਪਤੰਗੁ ਨਿਸੰਗੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਕਰਿ ਅਖਿ ੳੁਘਾੜੀ
transliteration: Jalai Patangu Nisangu Hoi Kari Akhi Oughaarhee.
translation: Moth fearlessly burns itself on the flame but goes on beholding in the face of the flame up to last.

gurmukhi: ਮਿਰਗ ਨਾਦਿ ਬਿਸਮਾਦੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਫਿਰਦਾ ਓਜਾੜੀ
transliteration: Mirag Naadi Bisamaadu Hoi Dhiradaa Ujaarhee.
translation: Overwhelmed by melody, the deer goes on wandering in the forests.

gurmukhi: ਕੁੰਡੀ ਫਾਥੇ ਮਛ ਜਿੳੁ ਰਸਿ ਜੀਭ ਵਿਗਾੜੀ
transliteration: Koundee Dhaaday Machh Jiu Rasi Jeebh Vigaarhee.
translation: Overpowered by the taste of tongue, the fish itself catches the hook.

gurmukhi: ਹਾਥਣਿ ਹਾਥੀ ਫਾਹਿਅਾ ਦੁਖ ਸਹੈ ਦਿਹਾੜੀ
transliteration: Haadani Haadee Dhaahiaa Doukh Sahai Dihaarhee.
translation: Out of lust for its female, the male elephant gets caught and bears sufferings for the rest of life.

gurmukhi: ਪੀਰ ਮੁਰੀਦਾ ਪਿਰਹੜੀ ਲਾੲਿ ਨਿਜ ਘਰਿ ਤਾੜੀ ||੩||
transliteration: Peer Mureedaa Piraharhee Laai Nij Ghari Taarhee ?3?
translation: Likewise, the Sikhs of the Guru love their Guru and stablize themselves in their true selves.

gurmukhi: ੪ ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖ ਪ੍ਰੀਤਿ
translation: Love of a Gursikh

gurmukhi: ਚੰਦ ਚਕੋਰ ਪਰੀਤ ਹੈ ਲਾੲਿ ਤਾਰ ਨਿਹਾਲੇ
transliteration: Chand Chakor Pareet Hai Laai Taar Nihaalay.
translation: Red-legged partridge (chakor) loves moon and hence stares at it without even losing its glance.

gurmukhi: ਚਕਵੀ ਸੂਰਜ ਹੇਤ ਹੈ ਮਿਲਿ ਹੋਨਿ ਸੁਖਾਲੇ
transliteration: Chakavee Sooraj Hayt Hai Mili Honi Soukhaalay.
translation: Ruddy sheldrake (chakavi) loves sun, and in sunlight, meeting its beloved feels elated.

gurmukhi: ਨੇਹੁ ਕਵਲ ਜਲ ਜਾਣੀਅੈ ਖਿੜਿ ਮੁਹ ਵੇਖਾਲੇ
transliteration: Nayhu Kaval Jal Jaaneeai Khirhi Muh Vaykhaalay.
translation: Lotus loves water and shows the water its blossomed face.

gurmukhi: ਮੋਰ ਬਬੀਹੇ ਬੋਲਦੇ ਵੇਖਿ ਬਦਲ ਕਾਲੇ
transliteration: Mor Babeehay Boladay Vaykhi Badal Kaalay.
translation: Rain birds and peacocks also shriek when they see the clouds.

gurmukhi: ਨਾਰਿ ਭਤਾਰ ਪਿਅਾਰੁ ਹੈ ਮਾਂ ਪੁਤ ਸਮ੍ਹਾਲੇ
transliteration: Naari Bhataar Piaaru Hai Maan Pout Samhaalay.
translation: Wife loves her husband and mother takes care of the son.

gurmukhi: ਪੀਰ ਮੁਰੀਦਾ ਪਿਰਹੜੀ ਓਹੁ ਨਿਬਹੈ ਨਾਲੇ ||੪||
transliteration: Peer Mureedaa Piraharhee Aohu Nibahai Naalay ?4?
translation: Similarly the Sikh loves Guru and this love accompanies him to the end.

gurmukhi: ੫ ਪੀਰ ਮੁਰੀਦ ਦੀ ਪ੍ਰੀਤ
translation: Love between Sikh and the Guru

gurmukhi: ਰੂਪੈ ਕਾਮੈ ਦੋਸਤੀ ਜਗ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਜਾਣੀ
transliteration: Roopai Kaamai Dosatee Jag Andari Jaanee.
translation: Friendship of beauty and lust is known all over the world.

gurmukhi: ਭੁਖੈ ਸਾਦੈ ਗੰਢੁ ਹੈ ਓਹੁ ਵਿਰਤੀ ਹਾਣੀ
transliteration: Bhoukhai Saadai Ganddhu Hai Aohu Viratee Haanee.
translation: And this is very practical that hunger and taste are complementry.

gurmukhi: ਘੁਲਿ ਮਿਲਿ ਮਿਚਲਿ ਲਬਿ ਮਾਲਿ ੲਿਤੁ ਭਰਮ ਭੁਲਾਣੀ
transliteration: Ghuli Mili Michali Labi Maali Itu Bharami Bhulaanee.
translation: Greed and wealth also mix up with each other and remain deluded.

gurmukhi: ੳੂਘੈ ਸੳੁੜਿ ਪਲੰਘ ਜਿੳੁ ਸਭਿ ਰੈਣਿ ਵਿਹਾਣੀ
transliteration: Oughai Saurhi Palagh Jiu Sabhi Raini Vihaanee.
translation: For a dozing person, even a small cot is a pleasure to pass the night.

gurmukhi: ਸੁਹਣੇ ਸਭ ਰੰਗ ਮਾਣੀਅਨਿ ਕਰਿ ਚੋਜ ਵਿਡਾਣੀ
transliteration: Suhanay Sabh Rang Maaneeani Kari Choj Vidaanee.
translation: In the dream, one enjoys every colour of events.

gurmukhi: ਪੀਰ ਮੁਰੀਦਾਂ ਪਿਰਹੜੀ ਓਹੁ ਅਕਥ ਕਹਾਣੀ ||੫||
transliteration: Peer Mureedaan Piraharhee Aohu Akad Kahaanee ?5?
translation: Likewise, indescribable is the story of the love of the Sikh and the Guru

gurmukhi: ੬ ਪੀਰ ਮੁਰੀਦ ਦੀ ਪ੍ਰੀਤ
translation: Love between Sikh and the Guru

gurmukhi: ਮਾਨ ਸਰੋਵਰੁ ਹੰਸਲਾ ਖਾੲਿ ਮਾਣਕ ਮੋਤੀ
transliteration: Maan Sarovar Hansalaa Khaai Maanak Motee.
translation: The swan of Mansarovar picks up only pearls and jewels.

gurmukhi: ਕੋੲਿਲ ਅੰਬ ਪਰੀਤਿ ਹੈ ਮਿਲ ਬੋਲ ਸਰੋਤੀ
transliteration: Koil Anb Pareeti Hai Mil Bol Sarotee.
translation: The nightingale and mango tree bear love for each other, and hence it sings thereupon.

gurmukhi: ਚੰਦਨ ਵਾਸੁ ਵਣਾਸੁਪਤਿ ਹੋੲਿ ਪਾਸ ਖਲੋਤੀ
transliteration: Chandan Vaasu Vanaasoupati Hoi Paas Khalotee.
translation: The sandal loves whole vegetation, and whosoever is near it, becomes fragrant.

gurmukhi: ਲੋਹਾ ਪਾਰਸਿ ਭੇਟਿਅੈ ਹੋੲਿ ਕੰਚਨ ਜੋਤੀ
transliteration: Lohaa Paarasi Bhaytiai Hoi Kanchan Jotee.
translation: Touching the philosopher's stone the iron brightens like gold.

gurmukhi: ਨਦੀਅਾ ਨਾਲੇ ਗੰਗ ਮਿਲਿ ਹੋਨਿ ਛੋਤ ਅਛੋਤੀ
transliteration: Nadeeaa Naalay Gang Mili Honi Chhot Achhotee.
translation: Even the defiled streams, meeting the Ganges, become sacred.

gurmukhi: ਪੀਰ ਮੁਰੀਦਾਂ ਪਿਰਹੜੀ ੲਿਹ ਖੇਪ ਸਓਤੀ ||੬||
transliteration: Peer Mureedaan Piraharhee Ih Khayp Saaotee ?6?
translation: Such is also the love between the Sikh and the Guru, and to a Sikh, this is most priceless commodity.

gurmukhi: ੭ ਸੱਚਾ ਸਾਕ
translation: True relationship

gurmukhi: ਸਾਹੁਰੁ ਪੀਹਰੁ ਪਖ ਤ੍ਰੈ ਘਰੁ ਨਾਨੇਹਾਲਾ
transliteration: Saahuru Peeharu Pakh Trai Gharu Naanayhaalaa.
translation: There are three types of relationship - first those of father, mother, sister, brother and their offspring and alliances;

gurmukhi: ਸਹੁਰਾ ਸਸੁ ਵਖਾਣੀਅੈ ਸਾਲੀ ਤੈ ਸਾਲਾ
transliteration: Sahuraa Sasu Vakhaaneeai Saalee Tai Saalaa.
translation: Second, mother's father, mother's mother, mother's sisters, mother's brothers;

gurmukhi: ਮਾ ਪਿੳੁ ਭੈਣਾਂ ਭਾੲਿਰਾ ਪਰਵਾਰੁ ਦੁਰਾਲਾ
transliteration: Maa Piu Bhainaa Bhaairaa Paravaaru Duraalaa.
translation: Third, father-in-law, mother-in-law, brother-in-law, and sister-in-law.

gurmukhi: ਨਾਨਾ ਨਾਨੀ ਮਾਸੀਅਾਂ ਮਾਮੇ ਜੰਜਾਲਾ
transliteration: Naanaa Naanee Maaseeaa Maamay Janjaalaa.
translation: For them, gold, silver, diamonds, and corals are amassed.

gurmukhi: ਸੁੲਿਨਾ ਰੁਪਾ ਸੰਜੀਅੈ ਹੀਰਾ ਪਰਵਾਲਾ
transliteration: Suinaa Roupaa Sanjeeai Heeraa Paravaalaa.
translation: But dearer than all is the love of the Guru's Sikhs for the Guru,

gurmukhi: ਪੀਰ ਮੁਰੀਦਾਂ ਪਿਰਹੜੀ ੲੇਹੁ ਸਾਕੁ ਸੁਖਾਲਾ ||੭||
transliteration: Peer Mureedaan Piraharhee Ayhu Saaku Soukhaalaa ?7?
translation: And, this is the relationship which brings happiness.

gurmukhi: ੮ ਸੱਚਾ ਕੰਮ
translation: The true business

gurmukhi: ਵਣਜੁ ਕਰੈ ਵਾਪਾਰੀਅਾ ਤਿਤੁ ਲਾਹਾ ਤੋਟਾ
transliteration: Vanaju Karai Vaapaareeaa Titu Laahaa Totaa.
translation: The trader trades and he earns profits as well as loss.

gurmukhi: ਕਿਰਸਾਣੀ ਕਿਰਸਾਣੁ ਕਰਿ ਹੋੲਿ ਦੁਬਲਾ ਮੋਟਾ
transliteration: Kirasaanee Kirasaanu Kari Hoi Doubalaa Motaa.
translation: The farmer cultivates and thus increases or decreases.

gurmukhi: ਚਾਕਰੁ ਲਗੈ ਚਾਕਰੀ ਰਣਿ ਖਾਂਦਾ ਚੋਟਾਂ
transliteration: Chaakaru Lagai Chaakaree Rani Khaandaa Chotaan.
translation: The servant serves and gets blows in the battlefield.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਜੁ ਜੋਗੁ ਸੰਸਾਰੁ ਵਿਚਿ ਵਣ ਖੰਡ ਗੜ ਕੋਟਾ
transliteration: Raaju Jogu Sansaaru Vichi Van Khand Garh Kotaa.
translation: The results of ruling, living as a yogi, residing in the world, forest

gurmukhi: ਅੰਤਿ ਕਾਲਿ ਜਮਜਾਲੁ ਪੈ ਪਾੲੇ ਫਲ ਫੋਟਾ
transliteration: Anti Kaali Jam Jaalu Pai Paaay Phal Dhotaa.
translation: And forts are such that ultimately man is caught in the web of yama i.e. he goes on transmigrating.

gurmukhi: ਪੀਰ ਮੁਰੀਦਾਂ ਪਿਰਹੜੀ ਹੁੲਿ ਕਦੇ ਨਾ ਤੋਟਾ ||੮||
transliteration: Peer Mureedaan Piraharhee Hui Kaday N Totaa ?8?
translation: But such is love between the Sikh and his Guru that loss is never suffered.

gurmukhi: ੯ ਸੱਚਾ ਭੋਗ
translation: True enjoyment

gurmukhi: ਅਖੀ ਵੇਖਿ ਨ ਰਜੀਅਾ ਬਹੁ ਰੰਗ ਤਮਾਸੇ
transliteration: Akhee Vaykhi N Rajeeaa Bahu Rang Tamaasay.
translation: The eyes are not satisfied with beholding sights and exhibitions;

gurmukhi: ੳੁਸਤਤਿ ਨਿੰਦਾ ਕੰਨਿ ਸੁਣਿ ਰੋਵਣਿ ਤੈ ਹਾਸੇ
transliteration: Ousatati Nidaa Kanni Souni Rovani Tai Haasay.
translation: The ears are not satisfied with hearing praise or blame, mourning or rejoicing;

gurmukhi: ਸਾਦੀਂ ਜੀਭ ਨ ਰਜੀਅਾ ਕਰਿ ਭੋਗ ਬਿਲਾਸੇ
transliteration: Saadeen Jeebh N Rajeeaa Kari Bhog Bilaasay.
translation: The tongue is not satisfied with eating what affords pleasure and delight;

gurmukhi: ਨਕ ਨ ਰਜਾ ਵਾਸੁ ਲੈ ਦੁਰਗੰਧ ਸੁਵਾਸੇ
transliteration: Nak N Rajaa Vaasu Lai Duragandh Suvaasay.
translation: The nose is not contented with good or evil odour;

gurmukhi: ਰਜਿ ਨ ਕੋੲੀ ਜੀਵਿਅਾ ਕੂੜੇ ਭਰਵਾਸੇ
transliteration: Raji N Koee Jeeviaa Koorhay Bharavaasay.
translation: Nobody is satisfied with his span of life, and everyone entertains false hopes.

gurmukhi: ਪੀਰ ਮੁਰੀਦਾਂ ਪਿਰਹੜੀ ਸਚੀ ਰਹਰਾਸੇ ||੯||
transliteration: Peer Mureedaan Piraharhee Sachee Raharaasay ?9?
translation: But the Sikhs are satisfied with the Guru and theirs is the true love and delight.

gurmukhi: ੧੦ ਸੱਚੀ ਅੰਗ ਸਫਲਤਾ
translation: Worth of the limbs

gurmukhi: ਧ੍ਰਿਗੁ ਸਿਰੁ ਜੋ ਗੁਰ ਨਾ ਨਿਵੈ ਗੁਰ ਲਗੈ ਨ ਚਰਣੀ
transliteration: Dhrigu Siru Jo Gur N Nivai Gur Lagai N Charanee.
translation: Cursed is the head that bows not before the Guru and touches not his feet.

gurmukhi: ਧ੍ਰਿਗੁ ਲੋੲਿਣਿ ਗੁਰ ਦਰਸ ਵਿਣੁ ਵੇਖੈ ਪਰ ਤਰਣੀ
transliteration: Dhrigu Loini Gur Daras Vinu Vaykhai Par Taranee.
translation: Cursed are the eyes who instead of beholding the Guru behold another's wife.

gurmukhi: ਧ੍ਰਿਗ ਸਰਵਣਿ ੳੁਪਦੇਸ ਵਿਣੁ ਸੁਣਿ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਨ ਧਰਣੀ
transliteration: Dhrig Saravani Oupadays Vinu Souni Surati N Dharanee.
translation: Those ears are (also) cursed which do not listen to the sermon of the Guru and do not concentrate upon it'

gurmukhi: ਧ੍ਰਿਗੁ ਜਿਹਬਾ ਗੁਰ ਸਬਦ ਵਿਣੁ ਹੋਰ ਮੰਤ੍ਰ ਸਿਮਰਣੀ
transliteration: Dhrigu Jihabaa Gur Sabad Vinu Hor Mantr Simaranee.
translation: Cursed is that tongue which recites • mantras other than the word of the Guru

gurmukhi: ਵਿਣੁ ਸੇਵਾ ਧ੍ਰਿਗੁ ਹਥ ਪੈਰ ਹੋਰ ਨਿਹਫਲ ਕਰਣੀ
transliteration: Vinu Sayvaa Dhrigu Had Pair Hor Nihaphal Karanee.
translation: Without service, cursed are the heads, and feet, and useless are other deeds.

gurmukhi: ਪੀਰ ਮੁਰੀਦਾਂ ਪਿਰਹੜੀ ਸੁਖ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਸਰਣੀ ||੧੦||
transliteration: Peer Mureedaan Piraharhee Soukh Satigur Saranee ?10?
translation: The (true) love is there between the Sikh and the Guru and the real delight is there in the shelter of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ੧੧ ਸੱਚੀ ਲਗਨ
translation: The true devotion

gurmukhi: ਹੋਰਤੁ ਰੰਗਿ ਨ ਰਚੀਅੈ ਸਭੁ ਕੂੜ ਦਿਸੰਦਾ
transliteration: Horatu Rangi N Racheeai Sabhu Koorhu Disandaa.
translation: Love none but the Guru; all other love is false.

gurmukhi: ਹੋਰਤੁ ਸਾਦਿ ਨ ਲਗੀਅੈ ਹੋੲਿ ਵਿਸੁਲ ਗੰਦਾ
transliteration: Horatu Saadi N Lageeai Hoi Visu Lagandaa.
translation: Enjoy no other relish than his, for it would be poisonous.

gurmukhi: ਹੋਰਤੁ ਰਾਗ ਨ ਰੀਝੀਅੈ ਸੁਣਿ ਸੁਖ ਨ ਲਹੰਦਾ
transliteration: Horatu Raag N Reejheeai Souni Soukh N Lahandaa.
translation: Be not pleased with any one else's singing, for listening to it would bring no happiness.

gurmukhi: ਹੋਰੁ ਬੁਰੀ ਕਰਤੂਤਿ ਹੈ ਲਗੈ ਫਲੁ ਮੰਦਾ
transliteration: Horu Buree Karatooti Hai Lagai Phalu Mandaa.
translation: All acts not in conformity with the Guru's teaching, are evil, and bear evil fruit.

gurmukhi: ਹੋਰਤੁ ਪੰਥਿ ਨ ਚਲੀਅੈ ਠਗੁ ਚੋਰੁ ਮੁਹੰਦਾ
transliteration: Horatu Panthi N Chaleeai Tdagu Choru Muhandaa.
translation: Walk only in the way of true Guru, because in all other ways, there are thieves who cheat and rob.

gurmukhi: ਪੀਰ ਮੁਰੀਦਾਂ ਪਿਰਹੜੀ ਸਚੁ ਸਚਿ ਮਿਲੰਦਾ ||੧੧||
transliteration: Peer Mureedaan Piraharhee Sachu Sachi Miladaa ?11?
translation: The love of the Guru's Sikhs for the Guru causes their soul to blend their truth with the Truth.

gurmukhi: ੧੨ ਸੱਚੀ ਲਗਨ
translation: The true devotion

gurmukhi: ਦੂਜੀ ਅਾਸ ਵਿਣਾਸੁ ਹੈ ਪੂਰੀ ਕਿੳੁ ਹੋਵੈ
transliteration: Doojee Aas Vinaasu Hai Pooree Kiu Hovai.
translation: Other hopes (except Lord's) are ruination; how could they be accomplished.

gurmukhi: ਦੂਜਾ ਮੋਹ ਸੁ ਧ੍ਰੋਹ ਸਭੁ ਓਹੁ ਅੰਤਿ ਵਿਗੋਵੈ
transliteration: Doojaa Moh Su Dhroh Sabhu Aohu Anti Vigovai.
translation: Other infatuations are delusion which ultimately lead (man) astray.

gurmukhi: ਦੂਜਾ ਕਰਮੁ ਸੁਭਰਮ ਹੈ ਕਰਿ ਅਵਗੁਣ ਰੋਵੈ
transliteration: Doojaa Karamu Soubharam Hai Kari Avagoun Rovai.
translation: Other actions are deceits by which man cultivates demerits and suffers.

gurmukhi: ਦੂਜਾ ਸੰਗੁ ਕੁਢੰਗੁ ਹੈ ਕਿੳੁ ਭਰਿਅਾ ਧੋਵੈ
transliteration: Doojaa Sangu Kuddhangu Hai Kiu Bhariaa Dhovai.
translation: The company of the sense of otherness is a perfidious way of living; and how it could wash away the sinful life.

gurmukhi: ਦੂਜਾ ਭਾੳੁ ਕੁਦਾੳੁ ਹੈ ਹਾਰਿ ਜਨਮੁ ਖਲੋਵੈ
transliteration: Doojaa Bhaau Kudaau Hai Haari Janamu Khalovai.
translation: The othemness is a wrong stake which ultimatley makes one lose the (battle of) life.

gurmukhi: ਪੀਰ ਮੁਰੀਦਾਂ ਪਿਰਹੜੀ ਗੁਣ ਗੁਣੀ ਪਰੋਵੈ ||੧੨||
transliteration: Peer Mureedaan Piraharhee Goun Gounee Parovai ?12?
translation: The love between the Sikhs and the Guru, brings the meritorious people closer and makes them one (sangat).

gurmukhi: ੧੩ ਗੁਰੂ ਜੀ ਦੀ ਪ੍ਰੀਤ ਦਾ ਰੂਪ
translation: The nature of the love of Guru

gurmukhi: ਅਮਿਓ ਦਿਸਟਿ ਕਰਿ ਕਛੁ ਵਾਂਗਿ ਭਵਜਲ ਵਿਚਿ ਰਖੈ
transliteration: Amiao Disati Kari Kachhu Vaangi Bhavajal Vichi Rakhai.
translation: As the contraction of limbs saves the tortoise, the ambrosial vision of the Guru saves the Sikh from the world ocean.

gurmukhi: ਗਿਅਾਨ ਅੰਸ ਦੇ ਹੰਸ ਵਾਂਗਿ ਬੁਝਿ ਭਖ ਅਭਖੈ
transliteration: Giaan Ans Day Hans Vaangi Bujhi Bhakh Abhakhai.
translation: Like a swan having discriminatory knowledge (of sifting water from milk), this vision of Guru provides wisdom about the edible and the inedible.

gurmukhi: ਸਿਮਰਣ ਕਰਦੇ ਕੂੰਜ ਵਾਂਗਿ ੳੁਡਿ ਲਖੈ ਅਲਖੈ
transliteration: Simaran Karaday Koonj Vaangi Udi Lakhai Alakhai.
translation: Like a Siberian crane which keeps in mind its off-springs, the Guru also always takes care of the disciples, and (through his spiritual powers) foresees the invisible.

gurmukhi: ਮਾਤਾ ਬਾਲਕ ਹੇਤੁ ਕਰਿ ਓਹੁ ਸਾੳੁ ਨ ਚਖੈ
transliteration: Maataa Baalak Haytu Kari Aohu Saau N Chakhai.
translation: As the mother shares not the pleasures of her son, the Guru also has no demand of the Sikh.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਦੲਿਅਾਲੁ ਹੈ ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਪਰਖੈ
transliteration: Satigur Purakhu Daiaalu Hai Gurasikh Parakhai.
translation: The true Guru is kind and (sometime) tests also the Sikhs.

gurmukhi: ਪੀਰ ਮੁਰੀਦਾਂ ਪਿਰਹੜੀ ਲਖ ਮੁਲੀਅਨਿ ਕਖੈ ||੧੩||
transliteration: Peer Mureedaan Piraharhee Lakh Muleeani Kakhai ?13?
translation: The love between the Guru and the Sikh makes the latter valuable like a blade of grass made worthy of million (coins)

gurmukhi: ੧੪ ਗੁਰੂ ਨਾਲ ਪ੍ਰੀਤ ਦਾ ਰੂਪ
translation: Nature of the Love of Sikh with Guru

gurmukhi: ਦਰਸਨੁ ਦੇਖਿ ਪਤੰਗ ਜਿੳੁ ਜੋਤੀ ਜੋਤਿ ਸਮਾਵੈ
transliteration: Darasanu Daykhi Patang Jiu Jotee Joti Samaavai.
translation: Beholding the flame (of the lamp), as the moth mingles with the flame and

gurmukhi: ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਲਿਵ ਮਿਰਗ ਜਿੳੁ ਅਨਹਦ ਲਿਵ ਲਾਵੈ
transliteration: Sabad Surati Liv Mirag Jiu Anahad Liv Laavai.
translation: Deer absorbs its consciousness in the melodious Word, likewise in the river of holy congregation,

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਵਿਚਿ ਮੀਨੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਸੁਖ ਪਾਵੈ
transliteration: Saadhasangati Vichi Meenu Hoi Guramati Soukh Paavai.
translation: The Sikh becoming fish and adopting the way of the wisdom of the Guru, enjoys the life.

gurmukhi: ਚਰਣ ਕਵਲ ਚਿਤਿ ਭਵਰੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਸੁਖ ਰੈਣਿ ਵਿਹਾਵੈ
transliteration: Charan Kaval Vichi Bhavaru Hoi Soukh Raini Vihaavai.
translation: By becoming black bee of the lotus feet (of the Lord), the Sikh spends his night ecstatically.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ੳੁਪਦੇਸੁ ਨ ਵਿਸਰੈ ਬਾਬੀਹਾ ਧਿਅਾਵੈ
transliteration: Gur Oupadays N Visarai Baabeehaa Dhiaavai.
translation: He never forgets the teaching of the Guru and repeats it as the rainbird does in the rainy season.

gurmukhi: ਪੀਰ ਮੁਰੀਦਾਂ ਪਿਰਹੜੀ ਦੁਬਿਧਾ ਨਾ ਸੁਖਾਵੈ ||੧੪||
transliteration: Peer Mureedaan Piraharhee Doubidhaa Naa Soukhaavai ?14?
translation: The love between the Guru and the disciple is such that they do not like the sense of duality.

gurmukhi: ੧੫ ਗੁਰੂ ਸਰਬ ਤੋਂ ਸਮਰੱਥ ਹੈ
translation: The Guru is all powerful

gurmukhi: ਦਾਤਾ ਓਹੁ ਨ ਮੰਗੀਅੈ ਫਿਰਿ ਮੰਗਣਿ ਜਾੲੀਅੈ
transliteration: Daataa Aohu N Mangeeai Dhiri Mangani Jaaeeai.
translation: Ask not for a giver from whom you shall have to appeal to another

gurmukhi: ਹੋਛਾ ਸਾਹੁ ਨ ਕੀਚੲੀ ਫਿਰਿ ਪਛੋਤਾੲੀਅੈ
transliteration: Hochhaa Saahu N Keechaee Dhiri Pachhotaaeeai.
translation: Employ not a brusque banker who will afterwords make you repent.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਹਿਬੁ ਓਹੁ ਨ ਸੇਵੀਅੈ ਜਮ ਡੰਡੁ ਸਹਾੲੀਅੈ
transliteration: Saahibu Aohu N Sayveeai Jam Dandu Sahaaeeai.
translation: Serve not such a master as will render you liable to death's punishment.

gurmukhi: ਹੳੁਮੈ ਰੋਗੁ ਨ ਕਟੲੀ ਓਹੁ ਵੈਦੁ ਨ ਲਾੲੀਅੈ
transliteration: Haoumai Rogu N Kataee Aohu Vaidu N Laaeeai.
translation: Engage not a physician who cannot cure the malady of pride.

gurmukhi: ਦੁਰਮਤਿ ਮੈਲੁ ਨ ੳੁਤਰੈ ਕਿੳੁਂ ਤੀਰਥਿ ਨਾੲੀਅੈ
transliteration: Duramati Mailu N Outarai Kiu Teeradi Naaeeai.
translation: What is the use of bathing the body at the places of pilgrimages if the filth of evil inclinations is not cleansed.

gurmukhi: ਪੀਰ ਮੁਰੀਦਾਂ ਪਿਰਹੜੀ ਸੁਖ ਸਹਜਿ ਸਮਾੲੀਅੈ
transliteration: Peer Mureedaan Piraharhee Soukh Sahaji Samaaeeai ?15?
translation: The love between the Guru and the disciples brings happiness and composure.

gurmukhi: ੧੬ ਗੁਰੂ ਪ੍ਰੀਤ ਸਭ ਤੋਂ ੳੁੱਚੀ ਹੈ
translation: Highest is the love for Guru

gurmukhi: ਮਾਲੁ ਮੁਲਕੁ ਚਤੁਰੰਗ ਦਲ ਦੁਨੀਅਾ ਪਤਿਸਾਹੀ
transliteration: Maalu Mulaku Chaturang Dal Douneeaa Patisaahee.
translation: If being master of army having four divisions (elephant, chariot, horse and infantry), country and the wealth;

gurmukhi: ਰਿਧਿ ਸਿਧਿ ਨਿਧਿ ਬਹੁ ਕਰਾਮਾਤਿ ਸਭ ਖਲਕ ੳੁਮਾਹੀ
transliteration: Ridhi Sidhi Nidhi Bahu Karaamaati Sabh Khalak Oumaahee.
translation: If having attraction for others due to possession of miracles through ridhis and siddhis;

gurmukhi: ਚਿਰੁ ਜੀਵਣੁ ਬਹੁ ਹੰਢਣਾਂ ਗੁਣ ਗਿਅਾਨ ੳੁਗਾਹੀ
transliteration: Chiru Jeevanu Bahu Handdhanaa Goun Giaan Ougaahee.
translation: If living a long life full of qualities and knowledge

gurmukhi: ਹੋਰਸੁ ਕਿਸੈ ਨ ਜਾਣੲੀ ਚਿਤਿ ਬੇਪਰਵਾਹੀ
transliteration: Horasu Kisai N Jaanaee Chiti Bayparavaahee.
translation: And if being enough powerful to care for nobody is still engrossed in dilemma,

gurmukhi: ਦਰਗਹ ਢੋੲੀ ਨਾ ਲਹੈ ਦੁਬਿਧਾ ਬਦਰਾਹੀ
transliteration: Daragah Ddhoee N Lahai Doubidhaa Badaraahee.
translation: He cannot have shelter in the court of Lord.

gurmukhi: ਪੀਰ ਮੁਰੀਦਾਂ ਪਿਰਹੜੀ ਪਰਵਾਣੁ ਸੁ ਘਾਹੀ ||੧੬||
transliteration: Peer Mureedaan Piraharhee Paravaanu Su Ghaahee ?16?
translation: Due to love for his Guru, even an ordinary grass cutter Sikh becomes acceptable.

gurmukhi: ੧੭ ਗੁਰੂ ਨਾਲ ਦਾ ਰੂਪ, ਪ੍ਰੀਤ
translation: Everything futile except love for the Guru   ,

gurmukhi: ਵਿਣੁ ਗੁਰੁ ਹੋਰੁ ਧਿਅਾਨੁ ਹੈ ਸਭ ਦੂਜਾ ਭਾੳੁ
transliteration: Vinu Guru Horu Dhiaanu Hai Sabh Doojaa Bhaau.
translation: The concentration except on Guru is all duality.

gurmukhi: ਵਿਣੁ ਗੁਰ ਸਬਦ ਗਿਅਾਨੁ ਹੈ ਫਿਕਾ ਅਾਲਾੳੁ
transliteration: Vinu Gur Sabad Giaanu Hai Dhikaa Aalaau.
translation: The knowledge except theknowledge of the Guru-word is a cry in vain.

gurmukhi: ਵਿਣੁ ਗੁਰ ਚਰਣਾ ਪੂਜਣਾ ਸਭੁ ਕੂੜਾ ਸੁਅਾੳੁ
transliteration: Vinu Gur Charanaan Poojanaa Sabhu Koorhaa Suaau.
translation: Worship except the Guru feet is all false and selfishness.

gurmukhi: ਵਿਣੁ ਗੁਰੁ ਬਚਨੁ ਜੁ ਮੰਨਣਾ ੳੂਰਾ ਪਰਥਾੳੁ
transliteration: Vinu Gur Bachanu Ju Mannanaa Ooraa Paradaau.
translation: Except the acceptance of the teaching of the Guru, all other means are incomplete.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਵਿਣੁ ਸੰਗੁ ਹੈ ਸਭੁ ਕਚਾ ਚਾੳੁ
transliteration: Saadhasangati Vinu Sangu Hai Sabhu Kachaa Chaau.
translation: Except the meeting in the holy congregation, all other assemblages are fragile.

gurmukhi: ਪੀਰ ਮੁਰੀਦਾਂ ਪਿਰਹੜੀ ਜਿਣਿ ਜਾਣਨਿ ਦਾੳੁ ||੧੭||
transliteration: Peer Mureedaan Piraharhee Jini Jaanani Daau ?17?
translation: The Sikhs loving their Guru, know well to win the game (of life).

gurmukhi: ੧੮ ਗੁਰੂ ਪ੍ਰੀਤ ਹੳੁਂ ਤੋੜਦੀ ਹੈ
translation: Love for the Guru decimates ego

gurmukhi: ਲਖ ਸਿਅਾਣਪ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਲਖ ਲਖ ਗੁਣ ਚਤੁਰਾੲੀ
transliteration: Lakh Siaanap Surati Lakh Lakh Goun Chaturaaee.
translation: One may have millions of wisdoms, consciousness, qualities, meditations, honours, japs,

gurmukhi: ਲਖ ਮਤਿ ਬੁਧਿ ਸੁਧਿ ਗਿਅਾਨ ਧਿਅਾਨ ਲਖਪਤਿ ਵਡਿਅਾੲੀ
transliteration: Lakh Mati Budhi Sudhi Giaan Dhiaan Lakh Pati Vadiaaee.
translation: Penances, continences, bathings on pilgrimage centres, karmas, dharmas yogas,

gurmukhi: ਲਖ ਜਪ ਤਪ ਲਖ ਸੰਜਮਾ ਲਖ ਤੀਰਥ ਨ੍ਹਾੲੀ
transliteration: Lakh Jap Tap Lakh Sanjamaan Lakh Teerad Nhaaee.
translation: Enjoyments rind recitations of holy scriptures to his credit.

gurmukhi: ਕਰਮ ਧਰਮ ਲਖ ਜੋਗ ਭੋਗ ਲਖ ਪਾਠ ਪੜ੍ਹਾੲੀ
transliteration: Karam Dharam Lakh Jog Bhog Lakh Paatd Parhhaaee.
translation: But still, if such a person controlled by ego wishes to be noticed by others,

gurmukhi: ਅਾਪੁ ਗਣਾੲਿ ਵਿਗੁਚਣਾ ਓਹੁ ਥਾੲਿ ਨ ਪਾੲੀ
transliteration: Aapu Ganaai Vigouchanaa Aohu Daai N Paaee.
translation: He has gone astray and cannot fathom the Lord (and His creation).

gurmukhi: ਪੀਰ ਮੁਰੀਦਾਂ ਪਿਰਹੜੀ ਹੋੲਿ ਅਾਪੁ ਗਵਾੲੀ ||੧੮||
transliteration: Peer Mureedaan Piraharhee Hoi Aapu Gavaaee ?18?
translation: If the love prevails between the Guru and the disciple, the sense of ego vanishes (in the thin air).

gurmukhi: ੧੯ ਮੁਰੀਦ ਦੀ ਸੇਵਾ ਦਾ ਰੂਪ
translation: Nature of service by the disciples

gurmukhi: ਪੈਰੀ ਪੈ ਪਾਖਾਕ ਹੋੲਿ ਛਡਿ ਮਣੀ ਮਨੂਰੀ
transliteration: Pairee Pai Paa Khaak Hoi Chhadi Manee Manooree.
translation: The Sikh of the Guru, falling at the feet (of Guru) forswears his ego and desires of mind.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਣੀ ਪਖਾ ਪੀਹਣਾ ਨਿਤ ਕਰੈ ਮਜੂਰੀ
transliteration: Paanee Pakhaa Peehanaa Nit Karai Majooree.
translation: He fetches water, fans the congregation, grinds flour (for latigar) and does all manual jobs.

gurmukhi: ਤ੍ਰਪੜ ਝਾੜਿ ਵਿਛਾੲਿੰਦਾ ਚੁਲਿ ਝੋਕਿ ਨ ਝੂਰੀ
transliteration: Traparh Jhaarhi Vichhaaindaa Chuli Jhoki N Jhooree.
translation: He cleanses and spreads the sheets and gets not dejected while putting fire in the hearth.

gurmukhi: ਮੁਰਦੇ ਵਾਂਗਿ ਮੁਰੀਦੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਕਰਿ ਸਿਦਕ ਸਬੂਰੀ
transliteration: Muraday Vaangi Mureedu Hoi Kari Sidak Sabooree.
translation: He adopts the contentment like a dead person does.

gurmukhi: ਚੰਦਨੁ ਹੋਵੈ ਸਿੰਮਲਹੁ ਫਲੁ ਵਾਸੁ ਹਜੂਰੀ
transliteration: Chandanu Hovai Sinmalahu Phalu Vaasu Hajooree.
translation: He gets such a fruit of living near the Guru, as the silk-cotton tree gets by being near the sandal tree i.e. it also becomes fragrant.

gurmukhi: ਪੀਰ ਮੁਰੀਦਾਂ ਪਿਰਹੜੀ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਮਤਿ ਪੂਰੀ ||੧੯||
transliteration: Peer Mureedaan Piraharhee Guramoukhi Mati Pooree ?19?
translation: The Sikhs loving the Guru make their wisdom complete.

gurmukhi: ੨੦ ਗੁਰ ਸੇਵਾ ਫਲ
translation: Fruit of Guru-service

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਸੇਵਾ ਦਾ ਫਲੁ ਘਣਾ ਕਿਨਿ ਕੀਮਤਿ ਹੋੲੀ
transliteration: Gur Sayvaa Daa Phalu Ghanaa Kini Keemati Hoee.
translation: Immense is the fruit of the service to the Guru; who can understand its worth.

gurmukhi: ਰੰਗ ਸੁਰੰਗੁ ਅਚਰਜੁ ਹੈ ਵੇਖਾਲੈ ਸੋੲੀ
transliteration: Rangu Surangu Acharaju Hai Vaykhaalay Soee.
translation: From among the wondrous shades (of life) it makes one see the most wonderful one.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਦੁ ਵਡਾ ਵਿਸਮਾਦੁ ਹੈ ਰਸੁ ਗੁੰਗੇ ਗੋੲੀ
transliteration: Saadu Vadaa Visamaadu Hai Rasu Goungay Goee.
translation: The taste of the service is as awesome as the sweet is to the dumb person.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਤਭੁਜ ਵਾਸੁ ਨਿਵਾਸੁ ਹੈ ਕਰਿ ਚਲਤੁ ਸਮੋੲੀ
transliteration: Outabhuj Vaasu Nivaasu Hai Kari Chalatu Samoee.
translation: It is a great feat (of God) that the fragrance is there in the trees.

gurmukhi: ਤੋਲੁ ਅਤੋਲੁ ਅਮੋਲੁ ਹੈ ਜਰੈ ਅਜਰੁ ਕੋੲੀ
transliteration: Tolu Atolu Amolu Hai Jarai Ajaru Koee.
translation: The service is invaluable and incomparable; any rare endures this unendurable faculty.

gurmukhi: ਪੀਰ ਮੁਰੀਦਾਂ ਪਿਰਹੜੀ ਜਾਣੈ ਜਾਣੋੲੀ ||੨੦||
transliteration: Peer Mureedaan Piraharhee Jaanai Jaanoee ?20?
translation: Only God, the omniscient knows the mystery of the service.

gurmukhi: ੨੧ ਮੁਰੀਦ ਤਦਰੂਪ ਕਿੱਕੂੰ ਹੁੰਦਾ ਹੈ
translation: How disciple becomes one with Guru    ?

gurmukhi: ਚੰਨਣੁ ਹੋਵੈ ਚੰਨਣਹੁ ਕੋ ਚਲਿਤ ਨ ਜਾਣੈ
transliteration: Channanu Hovai Channanahu Ko Chalitu N Jaanai.
translation: None knows the mystery how in the association of sandal, other trees transform into sandal.

gurmukhi: ਦੀਵਾ ਬਲਦਾ ਦੀਵਿਅਹੁੰ ਸਮਸਰਿ ਪਰਵਾਣੈ
transliteration: Deevaa Baladaa Deeviahoun Samasari Paravaanai.
translation: From lamp is illumined the lamp and looks identical.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਣੀ ਰਲਦਾ ਪਾਣੀਅੈ ਤਿਸੁ ਕੋ ਨ ਸਿਞਞਞਞਾਣੈ
transliteration: Paanee Raladaa Paaneeai Tisu Ko N Siaanai.
translation: No one can identify that water which mixes into water.

gurmukhi: ਭ੍ਰਿੰਗੀ ਹੋਵੈ ਕੀੜਿਅਹੁ ਕਿਵ ਅਾਖਿ ਵਖਾਣੈ
transliteration: Bhringee Hovai Keerhiahu Kiv Aakhi Vakhaanai.
translation: The small aunt turns into bhringiinsect; none can tell about it.

gurmukhi: ਸਪੁ ਛੁਡੰਦਾ ਕੁੰਜ ਨੋ ਕਰਿ ਚੋਜ ਵਿਡਾਣੈ
transliteration: Sapu Chhudandaa Kounj No Kari Choj Vidaanai.
translation: The snake leaves its slough and this is again a wonderful feat.

gurmukhi: ਪੀਰ ਮੁਰੀਦਾਂ ਪਿਰਹੜੀ ਹੈਰਾਣੁ ਹੈਰਾਣੈ ||੨੧||
transliteration: Peer Mureedaan Piraharhee Hairaanu Hairaanai ?21?
translation: Similarly, the love between the Guru and disciple is wondrous.

gurmukhi: ੨੨ ਅਾਤਮ ਪ੍ਰਾਪਤੀ ਜੁਗਤ
translation: Technique of self realization

gurmukhi: ਫੁਲੀ ਵਾਸੁ ਨਿਵਾਸੁ ਹੈ ਕਿਤੁ ਜੁਗਤਿ ਸਮਾਣੀ
transliteration: Phulee Vaasu Nivaasu Hai Kitu Jougati Samaanee.
translation: The fragrance resides in the flowers but none knows how it takes place there.

gurmukhi: ਫਲਾ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਜਿੳੁ ਸਾਦੁ ਬਹੁ ਸਿੰਜੇ ੲਿਕ ਪਾਣੀ
transliteration: Phulaan Andari Jiu Saadu Bahu Sinjay Ik Paanee.
translation: Tastes of the fruits are varied, though the same water irrigates them.

gurmukhi: ਘਿੳੁ ਦੁਧ ਵਿਚਿ ਵਖਾਣੀਅੈ ਕੋ ਮਰਮੁ ਨ ਜਾਣੀ
transliteration: Ghiu Dudhu Vichi Vakhaaneeai Ko Maramu N Jaanee.
translation: Butter remains in the milk but none understands this mystery.

gurmukhi: ਜਿੳੁ ਬੈਸੰਤਰੁ ਕਾਠ ਵਿਚਿ ਓਹੁ ਅਲਖ ਵਿਡਾਣੀ
transliteration: Jiu Baisantaru Kaatd Vichi Aohu Alakh Vidaanee.
translation: In the gurmukhs, due to their discipline the realization of authentic self takes place.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੰਜਮਿ ਨਿਕਲੈ ਪਰਗਟੁ ਪਰਵਾਣੀ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Sanjami Nikalai Paragatu Paravaanee.
translation: For this all, the gurmukh applies the method of love for Guru,

gurmukhi: ਪੀਰ ਮੁਰੀਦਾਂ ਪਿਰਹੜੀ ਸੰਗਤਿ ਗੁਰਬਾਣੀ ||੨੨||
transliteration: Peer Mureedaan Piraharhee Sangati Gurabaanee ?22?
translation: Sangati and the hyms of the Guru, Gurbani

gurmukhi: ੨੩ ਸਿਰੁ ਦੀਜੈ ਕਾਣ ਨ ਕੀਜੈ
translation: Never hesitate in sacrifice

gurmukhi: ਦੀਪਕ ਜਲੈ ਪਤੰਗ ਵੰਸੁ ਫਿਰਿ ਦੇਖਿ ਨ ਹਟੈ
transliteration: Deepak Jalai Patang Vansu Dhiri Daykh N Hatai.
translation: Seeing the burning flame of the lamp the moths cannot withhold themselves.

gurmukhi: ਜਲ ਵਿਚਹੁ ਫੜਿ ਕਢੀਅੈ ਮਛ ਨੇਹੁ ਨ ਘਟੈ
transliteration: Jal Vichahu Dharhi Kaddheeai Machh Nayhu N Ghatai.
translation: The fish is taken out of water but still it does not give up its love for water.

gurmukhi: ਘੰਡਾ ਹੇੜੈ ਮਿਰਗ ਜਿੳੁ ਸੁਣਿ ਨਾਦੁ ਪਲਟੈ
transliteration: Ghandaa Hayrhai Mirag Jiu Souni Naad Palatai.
translation: As listening to the drum beat of the hunter, the deer turns towards the sound,

gurmukhi: ਭਵਰੈ ਵਾਸੁ ਵਿਣਾਸੁ ਹੈ ਫੜਿ ਕਵਲੁ ਸੰਘਟੈ
transliteration: Bhavarai Vaasu Vinaasu Hai Dharhi Kavalu Sanghatai.
translation: And the black bee by entering the flower perishes itself for enjoying the fragrance.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲੁ ਪਿਰਮ ਰਸੁ ਬਹੁ ਬੰਧਨ ਕਟੈ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Piram Rasu Bahu Bandhan Katai.
translation: Similarly, the gurmukhs enjoy the delight of love and liberate themselves from all the bondages.

gurmukhi: ਧੰਨੁ ਧੰਨੁ ਗੁਰਸਿੱਖ ਵੰਸੁ ਧੰਨੁ ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਨਿਧਿ ਖਟੈ ||੨੩||੨੭||
transliteration: Dhannu Dhannu Gurasikh Vansu Hai Dhannu Guramati Nidhi Khatai ?23?27?sataaee?
translation: The family lineage of theGuru and the Sikhs is blessed who following the wisdom of Guru realize the self.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਸਤਿ ਕਰਿ ਸਿੰਬਲ ਸਫਲ ਭੲੇ ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਸਤਿ ਕਰਿ ਬਾਂਸ ਮੈ ਸੁਗੰਧ ਹੈ
transliteration: Gurmati Sati Kari Sinbal Sadhal Bhaay , Gurmati Sati Kari Baans Mai Sougandh Hai ?
translation: Those who sincerely and faithfully follow the teachings of the True Guru turn into a fruit-bearing tree from a silk cotton tree (Simbal). That is to say that they become worthy from what good for nothing they were earlier. It is like egoistic bamboo tree

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਸਤਿ ਕਰਿ ਕੰਚਨ ਭੲੇ ਮਨੂਰ ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਸਤਿ ਕਰਿ ਪਰਖਤ ਅੰਧ ਹੈ
transliteration: Gurmati Sati Kari Kanchan Bhaay Manoora , Gurmati Sati Kari Parakhat Andh Hai ?
translation: Those who toil their lives on the teachings of Guru become glittering like gold (those who are highly noble and pious) from burnt out iron sludge (useless persons). The ignorants acquire assayer intellect and become knowledgeable.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਸਤਿ ਕਰਿ ਕਾਲਕੂਟ ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤ ਹੁੲਿ ਕਾਲ ਮੈ ਅਕਾਲ ਭੲੇ ਅਸਥਿਰ ਕੰਧ ਹੈ
transliteration: Gurmati Sati Kari Kaalakoot Anmrit Hui , Kaal Mai Akaal Bhaay Asadir Kandh Hai ?
translation: Those who imbibe Guru's teachings as true are filled with spiritual happiness shedding all the attachment with maya. They do not fear death any more and their body rests in the memory of the Lord forever.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਸਤਿ ਕਰਿ ਜੀਵਨ ਮੁਕਤ ਭੲੇ ਮਾੲਿਅਾ ਮੈ ੳੁਦਾਸ ਬਾਸ ਬੰਧ ਨਿਰਬੰਧ ਹੈ ||੨੭||
transliteration: Gurmati Sati Kari Jeevan Moukat Bhaay , Maaiaa Mai Udaas Baas Bandh Nirabandh Hai ?27?
translation: such people are emancipated from the love and attachment of worldly pleasures despite staying and living their life-span in this world. (27)
